name: opsrbas
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0

stmt.origin: opsrbaslem(cbs, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, nat1, w0)
stmt.pretty: opsrbaslem(cbs, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, nat1, w0)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cbs, c0), cfv(cbs, c1)))
-| wceq(c0, co(c2, cmps, c3))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(co(c2, copws, c3), c4))
-| wi(w0, wss(c4, cxp(c2, c2)))
-| wceq(cbs, cslot(nat1))
-| wcel(nat1, cn)
-| wbr(nat1, clt, cdc(nat1, nat0))
body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 →(Base ` c0)=(Base ` c1))
⊣ c0 =(c2[mPwSer]c3)
⊣ c1 =((c2[ordPwSer]c3)` c4)
⊣ (w0 → c4 ⊆(c2 × c2))
⊣ Base = Slot(1)
⊣ 1 ∈ ℕ
⊣ 1[<]cdc(1, 0)

-| wi(w0, wss(c4, cxp(c2, c2)))
-| wceq(cbs, cslot(nat1))
-| wcel(nat1, cn)
-| wbr(nat1, clt, cdc(nat1, nat0))

⊣ c0 =(c2[mPwSer]c3)
⊣ c1 =((c2[ordPwSer]c3)` c4)
⊣ (w0 → c4 ⊆(c2 × c2))
⊣ Base = Slot(1)
⊣ 1 ∈ ℕ
⊣ 1[<]cdc(1, 0)

comment: The base set of the ordered power series structure. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Feb-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 30-Aug-2015.)
